usageEnvironment.detectionEvidence: PrEntity used to select Element(); manipulates GenBeam and Beam objects; creates 3D geometry using tsl.dbCreate(); no _Viewport or sd_ prefixes found.

options: Two rows at one thirds of the studs

opmProperties.displayName: Cut the blocking flush to flat studs
Rotate the blocking to flat studs

{
  "scriptPurpose": {
    "summary": "Automates the generation of horizontal blocking (noggins) within timber wall elements to provide stiffness, backing for fixings, or fire integrity.",
    "category": "Framing",
    "typicalUseCase": "A user needs to add mid-height stiffeners between wall studs or continuous backing across the wall length for cladding support."
  },
  "parameters": [
    {
      "name": "sType",
      "technicalDefault": "Between studs",
      "businessMeaning": "Defines the placement strategy: creates individual blocking pieces cut to fit between each pair of studs, or creates continuous blocking members running the full length of the wall.",
      "validRange": "N/A (Dropdown)",
      "unit": "Selection",
      "affectsOutput": "Determines the quantity and length of generated beams (individual segments vs. continuous runs)."
    },
    {
      "name": "sMode",
      "technicalDefault": "Mid height",
      "businessMeaning": "Calculates the vertical position of the blocking. Options include the geometric center of the wall, center of the studs, specific absolute height, or distributed in two rows (1/3 heights).",
      "validRange": "N/A (Dropdown)",
      "unit": "Selection",
      "affectsOutput": "Sets the Y-coordinate (height) of the blocking elements relative to the element coordinate system."
    },
    {
      "name": "dBlockingHeight",
      "technicalDefault": 1200,
      "businessMeaning": "The absolute elevation (height from the bottom of the element) at which to place the blocking, used only when 'Height of Blockings' is set to 'Selected height'.",
      "validRange": "0 to Wall Height",
      "unit": "mm",
      "affectsOutput": "Sets the vertical placement when specific manual positioning is required."
    },
    {
      "name": "dMinLength",

      "businessMeaning": "The shortest permissible length for a blocking piece. Gaps smaller than this will receive no blocking to prevent manufacturing waste or handling issues.",
      "validRange": "0 to 200",
      "unit": "mm",
      "affectsOutput": "Filters out small blocking segments in narrow wall cavities or between tightly spaced studs."
    },
    {

      "affectsOutput": "Adjusts the length of the blocking slightly shorter or longer than the theoretical intersection point."
    },
    {
      "name": "strCutFlush",
      "technicalDefault": "No",
      "businessMeaning": "If Yes, the blocking ends are cut perfectly flush (square) against intersecting flat studs instead of following the stud's profile or just ending at the centerline.",

      "unit": "Boolean",

      "affectsOutput": "Changes the rotation/roll of the blocking beam where it meets flat studs."

    {

      "validRange": "N/A (Dropdown)",

    },

    }
  ],
  "parameterDependencies": [

        "strRotateFlush"
      ]
    },
    {
      "trigger": "sSizeOption is set to 'Element timber size'",

      "cascade": [
        "dSpecifiedHeight",
        "dSpecifiedWidth"
      ]
    },
    {
      "trigger": "sMode is NOT set to 'Selected height'",
      "effect": "The 'Enter the height for blockings' value is ignored in favor of calculated positions (mid-height

workflowDiagram: 1. User launches script from catalog or toolbar.
2. Script checks recursion state (insertCycleCount). If already running, it self-destructs to prevent loops.
3. Configuration dialog appears (if enabled) to set initial properties like Type, Height Mode, and Size.
4. Command line prompts user to 'Select one or More Elements'.
5. User selects one or more wall Elements and confirms.
6. Script iterates through selected Elements and spawns a new, persistent script instance attached to each one.
7. Original 'manager' instance erases itself.
8. Persistent instance retrieves current properties from the Element or OPM.
9. Script clears any previously generated blockings stored in the Element's Map data.
10. Script filters Element beams into categories (Vertical, Flat, Horizontal, Angled).
11. Script calculates blocking height(s) based on 'sMode' (Mid-height, Selected, Two rows, etc.).
12. Script determines cross-section size based on 'sSizeOption' (Element timber vs Specified).
13. Script generates blocking geometry based on 'sType':
a. 'Between studs': Creates short segments between vertical members.
b. 'Full length': Creates continuous members cut by vertical members.
14. Script applies geometric tools:
a. Cuts blocking to fit against vertical, flat, and angled beams.
b. Applies cut tolerance.
c. Rotates or aligns flush if 'strCutFlush'/'strRotateFlush' are enabled.
15. Script validates generated beams:
a. Removes beams shorter than 'dMinLength'.
b. Purges beams with erroneous/infinite lengths.
16. [Conditional] If 'Delete above opening' is Yes, script detects openings and removes blockings intersecting that zone.
17. Script applies final properties (No Nail status, Color) and saves new blockings to the Map.
18. Visual markers (lines) are drawn at blocking locations.

path1.name: Between studs
steps: Generate individual blocking for each gap

path2.name: Full length of wall
steps: Generate continuous blocking beam(s) across wall length
Apply cuts against all vertical/angled beams

path1.name: Selected height
steps: Place single row of blocking at absolute elevation

validationRules.recovery: If no element is selected or selection is cancelled, the script erases itself.
Generated blocking pieces shorter than the 'Minimum blocking length' are automatically discarded.
Beams identified as 'infinite' (length > 10km) due to geometry errors are purged automatically.

validationRules.errorMessage: ReportMessage: 'No tool, beam would be splitted'
validationRules.recovery: Indicates a complex geometry scenario where automatic cutting failed; user may need manual intervention, but script continues.

postInsertionActions.effect: Changing properties (e.g., Height, Type, Size) triggers the script to erase old blockings and regenerate new ones based on new parameters.

postInsertionActions.how: Modify Element (e.g., add opening, change height, move studs)
postInsertionActions.effect: Script reacts to element changes, regenerating blockings to fit the new wall profile (including handling 'Delete above opening' logic dynamically).
All generated blocking beams associated with the script are removed from the model (using the Map reference to find them).

data.markdown:
# hsb_CreateMidHeightBlocking.mcr

## Overview
This script automates the generation of horizontal blocking (noggins) within timber wall elements. It provides options for placing blocking between studs, running full wall lengths, or setting specific heights for structural stiffening or cladding backing.

## Usage Environment
| Space | Supported | Notes |
|-------|-----------|-------|
| Model Space | Yes | Script must be inserted into the 3D model. |
| Paper Space | No | Not applicable for layout views. |
| Shop Drawing | No | Does not generate 2D drawing views directly. |

## Prerequisites
- **Required Entities**: An existing hsbCAD Wall Element.
- **Minimum Beam Count**: 0 (It works on the element structure itself).
- **Required Settings**: None required to run, though defaults are set.

## Usage Steps

### Step 1: Launch Script
Command: `TSLINSERT` â†’ Select `hsb_CreateMidHeightBlocking.mcr`

### Step 2: Select Elements
```
Command Line: Select one or More Elements
Action: Click on the desired wall element(s) in the model and press Enter.
```

### Step 3: Configure Properties
```
Action: After selection, the script attaches to the element. Select the element and open the Properties Palette (Ctrl+1) to adjust blocking settings (Type, Height, Size, etc.).
```

## Properties Panel Parameters

| Parameter | Type | Default | Description |
|-----------|------|---------|-------------|
| **Type of blocking** | dropdown | Between studs | Determines if blocking is placed between individual studs or runs the full length of the wall. |
| **Height of Blockings** | dropdown | Mid height | Sets the vertical position: Mid height, Mid height of Studs, Zone 0 mid-height, a specific selected height, or two rows at 1/3 heights. |
| **Enter the height for blockings** | number | 1200 | The absolute height (mm) to place blocking if "Height of Blockings" is set to "Selected height". |
| **Minimum blocking length** | number | 50 | The shortest length (mm) allowed for a blocking piece; smaller pieces are skipped. |
| **Cut tolerance** | number | 0 | A small offset (mm) applied to cuts to adjust fit (can be negative or positive). |
| **Cut the blocking flush to flat studs** | dropdown | No | If "Yes", cuts blocking ends perfectly flush against flat studs. |
| **Rotate the blocking to flat studs** | dropdown | No | If "Yes", rotates the blocking orientation to align with flat studs. |
| **Stager the Blocking** | dropdown | No | If "Yes", staggers the blocking pieces so joints do not line up across bays. |
| **Delete above opening** | dropdown | No | If "Yes", automatically removes blocking geometry located above door or window openings. |
| **Set Blocking as NO Nail** | dropdown | No | If "Yes", marks the blocking as "No Nail" for production/CNC outputs. |
| **Beam Color** | number | 32 | Sets the AutoCAD color index for the blocking beams. |
| **Justification** | dropdown | Centre | Aligns the blocking depth to the Front, Centre, or Back of the wall. |
| **Rotate all blocking** | dropdown | No | Rotates the entire blocking member 90 degrees around its longitudinal axis. |
| **Size option** | dropdown | Element timber size | Choose to use the wall's default timber size or specify custom dimensions. |
| **Blocking width** | number | 38 | Custom thickness (depth into wall) when using "Specify size". |
| **Blocking height** | number | 140 | Custom vertical height when using "Specify size". |
| **Length of blocking depends on** | dropdown | Element length | Determines if continuous blocking spans the total element length or just "Zone 0". |

## Right-Click Menu Options

| Menu Item | Description |
|-----------|-------------|
| Erase | Removes the script instance and all associated blocking beams. |
| Properties | Opens the Properties Palette to modify the parameters listed above. |

## Settings Files
- **Filename**: None
- **Location**: N/A
- **Purpose**: This script does not rely on external XML settings files; all configuration is managed via the Properties Palette.

## Tips
- **Full Length Backing**: Use "Type of blocking" set to "Full length of wall" if you need continuous backing for plasterboard or cladding, rather than individual noggins.
- **Openings**: If blocking appears in unwanted areas above windows, switch "Delete above opening" to "Yes".
- **Recalculation**: The script reacts automatically to changes in the wall (e.g., moving studs or changing height). Simply update the wall geometry, and the blocking will adjust.

## FAQ
- **Q: Why are some gaps between studs missing blocking?**
  **A:** Check the "Minimum blocking length" property. If the gap between studs is smaller than this value, the script will skip it to avoid creating tiny, unusable pieces.
- **Q: How do I place blocking at a specific height, like 1000mm from the floor?**
  **A:** Set "Height of Blockings" to "Selected height", and then enter "1000" in the "Enter the height for blockings" field.
- **Q: Can I use different timber sizes for the blocking than the wall studs?**
  **A:** Yes. Change "Size option" to "Specify size" and input the desired dimensions for "Blocking width" and "Blocking height".
